text:
V Resorts receives recognition at the Smart CEO Startup50 2015 Awards
V Resorts proudly announces recognition as one of the top 50 ventures in the Smart CEO Startup50 2015 Awards held in Bangalore last month. One of only two companies in the hospitality space to receive this award, V Resorts has received recognition in the same space as start-ups like OYO Rooms, Urban Ladder, Paper Boat, Beer Café etc.
V Resorts is a hospitality start-up that focuses on aggregation and management, with a focus on developing new destinations for tourism in India where the resorts shall be run & supported by local communities. A professional company funded by reputed VCs, V Resorts is all about great escapes from the chaos of city life. V Resorts is headed by Aditi Balbir, the Co-Founder & MD of the company, who received the award from Senthil Kumar N from the office of the Shibulal Family at the Conference.
The Smart CEO Startup 50 Conference was conceptualized with a deep focus on ensuring a clutter-free conference focused on gathering high-end entrepreneurship knowledge from two categories of people – investors and entrepreneurs. The Smart CEO Startup 50 Awards aims to reward, recognize and honour entrepreneurs who’ve started up within the last six years (after April 2009) and have built wonderful businesses that make all their key stakeholders – customers, shareholders and employees – proud.
Talking on the occasion, Aditi Balbir said, “We are both proud and grateful to have made it into this prestigious list of the top 50 start-ups in the country. The felicitation recognizes us as a new age travel solution company that provides standardized premium experiences at offbeat and emerging locations. With 11 existing resorts and rigorous expansion plans, we aim to provide the best to our guests in the offbeat hospitality space.”
The winners were adjudged by a top notch jury comprising of Krishnakumar Natarajan, co-founder, MD and CEO of Mindtree, Krishnan Ganesh, four-time Serial entrepreneur, Partner at GrowthStory and Chairman Portea Medical, Kumar Shiralagi, Managing Director, Kalaari Capital and Investor in Myntra and Snapdeal, Senthil Kumar, Director of the family office of Infosys’ SD Shibulal and CEO of Tamara Coorg and Naganand Doraswamy, President of TiE Bangalore and co-founder SPAN Systems.
